cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi W of the western tip of Cuba and 540 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, then curving toward the northern Gulf Coast with a projected track over southeast Louisiana before drifting westward into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near or just south of New Orleans/Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sabine Pass, TX to the Alabama/Florida border (Storm Surge Watch area including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne, and Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated amounts to 5 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – 3 to 5 ft forecast for southeast LA coast including Plaquemines
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-73 mph) are possible by early Monday with a chance of hurricane-force gusts around landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3-5 ft above ground possible along Plaquemines Parish shoreline with large, battering waves
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated totals near 5 inches, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions, high surf and rip currents, possible short-lived tornadoes in outer rain bands
